littlefish.core.simulation module¶

class littlefish.core.simulation.Simulation(terrain, fish_list, simulation_length=100, food_num=5)[source]¶

Bases: object

Simulation class takes fish(s) and terrain to run the simulation of a fish’s activity during its life

fish_names¶
food_num¶

generating fish map containing all fishes according to self._fish_list at time_point

Parameters:
  • time_point – non-negative int, time_point in the simulation
  • is_plot – bool

return: fish_map, 2d array, uint16,

get_fish_health_status(t_point, verbose=False)[source]¶

check the health status of all the fish in the simulation at the time point, t_point. if the time point is not simulated (at least one fish position is [0, 0]), an error will raise.

Parameters:
  • t_point – non-negative integer, time point to evaluate
  • verbose – bool, if True, print the health_status
Returns:

dataframe, with index = fish_name, column=[‘health’]

check if the health of all fish are no higher than 0. at t_point in the simulation if the time point is not simulated (at least one fish position is [0, 0]), an error will raise.

Parameters:t_point – non-negative integer, time point to evaluate
Returns:bool

simulation_length¶
terrain_shape¶
littlefish.core.simulation.simulate_one_fish(fish_path, simulation_length, simulation_num, terrain_size, sea_level, food_num, hard_thr=0, fish_ind=0, fish_num=0)[source]¶

the function to simulate a fish’s lives in multiple terrain maps. the simulation results will be saved in the same input path ‘fish_path’.

Parameters:
  • fish_path – str, the path of an hdf5 file, with has a group ‘fish’ in root, which contains data of one and only one fish. Ideally generated by littlefish.fish.to_h5_group() method.
  • simulation_length – positive int, top length of each simulation in time unit.
  • simulation_num – positive int, number of terrain maps to simulate
  • terrain_size – tuple of two positive ints, pixel size if terrain maps, (row, col)
  • sea_level – float, (0., 1.), sea level to define terrain. lower see level will give fish a hard time.
  • food_num – non-negative int, how many food pellet(s) are presented at any given time in terrain map.
  • hard_thr – positive int, fish should have a life span longer than this threshold to be kept for simulation.
  • fish_ind – non-negative int, the index of the current fish in the whole population (generation). just for printout purpose, if not known, keep 0.
  • fish_num – non-negative int, the total number of fish in the whole population (generation). just for printout purpose, if not known, keep 0.
Returns:

None
